title: Flower basket
marks:
Signature

Bottom: [ 竹雲斎造 ] Bottom: [ 竹雲斎造 ]
text: This is an excellent example of a plaiting technique called senshū-ami, literally a “group of a thousand parallel lines” of bamboo gathered and tightly woven.
description: fine weave basket with raised loop handle; body tapers toward base; weave more open at top section with only vertical strands
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
